name: refile
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
law
  specialized to officially record something, especially in a law court, for a second, third, etc. time: He refused them the chance to refile the same complaint. After their lawsuit was dismissed, they immediately re-filed and were granted a new hearing.
More examplesFewer examplesThey hope to refile the murder charges when more evidence is gathered.The group re-filed the lawsuit with a new attorney representing them.Flight plans had to be refiled before aircraft could take off.
